channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Why are POGOs being given privilege to re-open? — Robredo
item.description: "We know that there is corruption, and the social costs on us are high because of the proliferation of POGOs."

item.title: COVID-19 cases in Philippines rise to 7,777 with 932 recoveries
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The number of virus infections worldwide has approached three million since the pathogen surfaced in China late last year. The global coronavirus death toll, meanwhile, reached 206,544.

item.title: Chinese Embassy's 'Iisang Dagat' video made people more angry, Carpio says
item.author: Patricia Lourdes Viray
item.description: While Beijing claims that its music video titled "Iisang Dagat" is a tribute for COVID-19 frontliners, there might be a subliminal message in it, retired Senior Associate Justice Antonio Carpio said.

item.title: Money supply growth slows for first time in 6 months —BSP
item.author: Prinz Magtulis
item.description: Despite last year's reductions in bank reserves and interest rate, money supply growth slowed in February due to low government spending.

item.title: Hontiveros urges gov't to make China pay for environmental damage in West Philippine Sea
item.description: The opposition senator filed Senate Resolution 369 calling on the executive branch to exert legal and diplomatic pressure on Beijing to cease all “ecologically destructive activities” in the West Philippine Sea and pay reparations for the damage.

item.title: COVID-19 cases behind bars show need for temporary release, detained petitioners stress
item.author: Kristine Joy Patag
item.description: “The existence of the foregoing confirmed and suspected cases shows the inability of prison authorities to prevent the transmission of the disease."

item.title: Carpio suggests joint patrols with Malaysia, Vietnam in South China Sea
item.author: Patricia Lourdes Viray
item.description: The Philippines should join forces with Malaysia and Vietnam to counter China's "grave escalation" of tensions in the South China Sea, retired Senior Associate Justice Antonio Carpio said.

item.title: Army wary of police 'prejudgment' in Ragos shooting
item.description: Lt. Col. Ramon Zagala, Army spokesperson, said the judge advocate general or the lawyer of the Army found prejudgment and conflicting statements from the policemen involved and the witnesses over the fatal shooting of former soldier Winston Ragos by a police officer.

item.title: DOT mourns death of former tourism chief Mon Jimenez
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: The Department of Tourism on Monday mourns the death of former tourism Secretary Ramon “Mon” Jimenez, who recently passed away. He was 64.

item.title: Alleged quarantine violation leads to altercation at gated Makati village
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "You should be on the frontlines...you have no idea how disrespectful you're being in this time when the Filipino people are struggling," Parra tells the police officer in a separate video.
